title: Drawing, "Fisherman and Women Stowing Nets in a Beached Dory, Cullercoats, England", 1881
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on light-gray wove paper, two sheeets joined, overlapping
dimensions:
Overall: 17.6 x 35.8 cm (6 15/16 x 14 1/8 in.)
each joined sheet: 26.8 x 18.2 cm (10 9/16 x 7 3/16 in.) (b)
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description:
Horizontal view of two fishermen, in a beached dory, stowing away a net, which is being fed out by two women standing at the water's edge;a small sailing craft is visible in the distance.

Please note: 1912-12-20-b shows the front of the dory at the extreme right of the image, and extends under 1912-12-20-a.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Fisherman and Women Stowing Nets in a Beached Dory, Cullercoats, England", 1881.
1881. Graphite, brush and white gouache on light-gray wove paper, two sheeets joined, overlapping. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-20-b.
